place.name: HEAPHAM
place.gazetteerText: HEAPHAM, a parish in Gainsborough district, Lincoln; at one of the sources of the river Brant, 3 miles E by N of Lea r. station, and 4½ ESE of Gainsborough. Post town, Gainsborough. Acres, 1, 250. Real property, £1, 483. Pop., 129. Houses, 25. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £245.* Patron, W.Amcotts, Esq. The church was recently in disrepair. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
